title: FTSE-Russell boosts London Stock Exchange's H1 earnings
text:
-0.6500 
(Adds context, share movement) 
Aug 5 (Reuters) - London Stock Exchange Group, Europe's oldest independent bourse, reported a 27 percent jump in its first-half adjusted operating profit, driven by robust growth in its global indexes business, FTSE-Russell. 
The stock ranked among the top gainers on the FTSE-100 Index in early trading on Wednesday. 
The company, which owns Borsa Italiana, MillenniumIT, Russell Investments and the London Stock Exchange (Other OTC: LDNXF - news ) , said its performance was also helped by underlying growth in its information services, capital markets, over-the-counter clearing at LCH.Clearnet and Italian post trade operations. 
LSEG had last year bought Seattle-based Frank Russell Co, the owner of the Russell 2000 stock market index, which measures the performance of small-cap U.S. stocks. 
RBC Capital Markets said LSEG's first-half results indicated that the management was continuing to deliver. Barclays (LSE: BARC.L - news ) raised its price target on the stock to 2840 pence from 2780 pence. 
Adjusted operating profit before amortisation of purchased intangibles and non-recurring items, rose to 366.1 million pounds ($569.69 million) from 288.8 million pounds a year earlier. 
The company has been trying to reduce its reliance on stock trading by tapping into faster growing businesses such as clearing and exchange-traded funds - low-cost funds that provide an alternative to active fund management. 
The 214-year-old exchange group said it would pay an interim dividend of 10.8 pence, up from 9.7 pence last year. ($1 = 0.6426 pounds) (Reporting by Aashika Jain in Bengaluru; Editing by Gopakumar Warrier and Anupama Dwivedi)
